name: standouts_title_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, plot
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title, plot for every movie.

Identify movies that stand out from the rest in the given information, as they may impact the perceived diversity of the list.
List of movies with similar features may feel more diverse if it includes one or more outliers.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A with the focus on outliers.
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B with the focus on outliers.
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C with the focus on outliers.
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.


List B:
TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

PLOT: After a selfish L.A. yuppie learns his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic-savant brother in Ohio that he didn't know existed, he absconds with his brother and sets out across the country, hoping to gain a larger inheritance.

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)
PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes.  The inclusion of Jurassic Park, a science fiction adventure, stands out from the more common action and thriller elements of the Bourne and Snatch films.  The presence of The Others (a supernatural thriller), A Beautiful Mind (a biographical drama), and The Hunger Games (dystopian fiction) further diversifies the list, creating a nice balance between action and more character-driven narratives.
response.list_B_description: List B has a more consistent tone than List A. While it includes some variety with genres like action (Avengers), comedy (School of Rock), and drama (Rain Man), the inclusion of Guardians of the Galaxy 2, The Others, and Moonrise Kingdom creates a subtle thematic thread of family and personal relationships, which could be considered a unifying element rather than a source of diversity.  Catch Me If You Can is an outlier in its focus on a con man.
response.list_C_description: List C is similar to List A in its diversity, but with a stronger emphasis on action and thriller. The inclusion of Edge of Tomorrow (sci-fi action with a time loop element) and War of the Worlds (alien invasion) adds a sci-fi/action subgenre that is not as prominent in List A.  The presence of Moonrise Kingdom (a whimsical coming-of-age story) acts as a significant outlier, contrasting with the more intense action films.
response.comparison: Lists A and C exhibit greater diversity than List B. List B has a more cohesive feel, with several films sharing thematic elements. List A offers a wider variety of genres and tones, while List C presents a blend of action/thriller with a notable outlier in the form of Moonrise Kingdom.  The outliers in both A and C significantly enhance the perceived diversity.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A is slightly more diverse because it has a better balance of genres and tones. While List C has strong outliers, the overall lean towards action and thriller is more pronounced. List A's inclusion of Jurassic Park, The Others, A Beautiful Mind, and The Hunger Games provides a more significant contrast to the action films, resulting in a more varied and engaging selection.

response.comparison: All three lists contain some overlap (Saving Private Ryan and Goodfellas appear in all three). List A has the most distinct outliers, creating a wider range of genres and tones. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C is the most diverse because, while maintaining a thread of action and drama, it incorporates more distinct outliers than List A or B. response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes. It includes animated movies (Inside Out), psychological thrillers (Shutter Island, Split), science fiction (The Matrix), dramas (Shawshank Redemption, Requiem for a Dream), crime (Pulp Fiction), and a dramedy (Intouchables).  The outlier here could be Inside Out, as it's an animated film significantly different in style and target audience from the others.
response.list_B_description: List B also offers variety, blending science fiction (Avatar, WALL-E), drama (Shawshank Redemption, A Beautiful Mind), comedy (Little Miss Sunshine), war (1917), and surrealism (Being John Malkovich).  The outlier is arguably Being John Malkovich due to its unique and highly surreal premise, contrasting with the more grounded narratives of the other films.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more cohesive set of films, primarily focusing on thrillers and dramas with some science fiction elements.  Avatar and 1917 are action-oriented, while Intouchables, Being John Malkovich, and Shutter Island have thriller elements. WALL-E is a unique outlier due to its animated nature and focus on environmental themes, while Knives Out and Gravity add mystery and sci-fi elements respectively.
response.comparison: List A has the broadest range of genres, while List B and C are more focused. List B has a stronger outlier in Being John Malkovich, which is more distinct from the other films than any outlier in List A or C. List C has a more cohesive set of films, with WALL-E as a notable outlier.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: While all three lists exhibit some diversity, List A stands out due to its wider range of genres and less thematic cohesion. Although List B has a strong outlier, the overall range of genres is slightly less diverse than List A. List C is more focused, making List A the most diverse.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes.  While it features crime thrillers like "The Usual Suspects" and "Captain Phillips", it also includes a romantic comedy ("Bridget Jones's Diary"), a sports drama ("Moneyball"), an animated film ("Shrek 2"), a war drama ("12 Years a Slave"), and a romantic ensemble piece ("Love Actually"). The outlier here is "Shrek 2", as it's the only animated film and significantly different in tone from the others.
response.list_B_description: List B has a more consistent tone than List A, focusing largely on action, drama, and crime.  "Monsters, Inc." stands out as an animated film, and "School of Rock" is a comedy, offering some genre diversity. However, the majority of films are action-oriented or character-driven dramas. The outlier here is "Monsters, Inc.", which is an animated film that differs significantly in tone and style from the other films.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of action, crime, and romantic genres.  "The Usual Suspects" and "John Wick: Chapter Two" are action-oriented crime thrillers.  "Love Actually" is a romantic comedy, and "50 First Dates" is a romantic comedy with a unique premise. "Notting Hill" is another romantic comedy, and "Now You See Me 2" is a heist film. The outliers here are "Love Actually", "50 First Dates", and "Notting Hill", which are all romantic comedies, offering a significant contrast to the action and crime themes of the other films.
response.comparison: List A displays more thematic and genre diversity than List B or C. List B has a more homogenous feel, with a few outliers. List C has a good mix of genres, but the romantic comedies stand out as a distinct cluster.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A offers the most diverse range of genres and tones. While List C has a good mix, the romantic comedies form a distinct subgroup. List B is the least diverse, with most films sharing similar action-oriented or character-driven themes.  List A's inclusion of an animated film, a romantic comedy, a historical drama, and crime thrillers makes it the most diverse.

response.comparison: List A exhibits the greatest diversity by including a wider range of genres and tones, with outliers that significantly contrast with the other films.
